oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Harry Burn telegram to mother.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Harry Burn, Nashville, Tenn., telegram to mother, Mrs. J. Burn, Niota, Tenn. August 20, 1920. Handwritten.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Politics & government; Telegrams;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "On their return from Nashville Photographers of New York papers may stop over there. Thought best to let you know if you cannot come to Nashville leaving there tonight. I will try to leave for Niota tomorrow pm (?). Am tired but ok fight apparently won but settled tomorrow. Harry."
